info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 08 at 1:41PM EST until January 10 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of piedmont North Carolina, including the following areas, Cabarrus, Davie, Iredell, Mecklenburg, Rowan and Union NC and upstate South Carolina, including the following areas, Chester, Union SC and York. * WHEN...From Tuesday morning through Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A powerful low pressure system will spread heavy rain across the region beginning this evening and continuing into Tuesday. Rainfall amounts of 3 to 5 inches are expected across the eastern Upstate south of Interstate 85, and the Piedmont of North Carolina. Some locations in the mountains could get 4 inches of rain. The threat of flash flooding has been increased given the recent rainfall in this area.north - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Watch for flash flooding means there is a potential for rapid onset flooding based on current forecasts. Flash flooding is a very dangerous situation and may impact areas that do not typically flood. Please monitor the latest forecasts and be prepared to take action quickly should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
